skill.description: Remove AI-generated code slop from a branch. Use when cleaning up AI-generated code, removing unnecessary comments, defensive checks, or type casts. Checks diff against main and fixes style inconsistencies.

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond standard Claude Code behavior. The skill provides instructions for code cleanup without any concerning capabilities.

content.user_title: Remove AI-generated code slop from branches
content.value_statement: AI-generated code often contains unnecessary comments, defensive checks, and style inconsistencies that clutter your codebase. This skill scans git diffs and removes these patterns while preserving legitimate changes.
actual_capabilities: Analyze git diff against main branch for changes
Identify and remove excessive AI-generated comments
Remove unnecessary defensive checks and try/catch blocks
Clean up casts to any that bypass type checking
Move inline Python imports to file top
Fix style inconsistencies in changed files
limitations: Only reviews files that have changed in the current branch
Does not modify files outside the git diff scope
Requires git repository with main branch

use_cases.title: Clean up PRs before review
use_cases.description: Remove AI-generated clutter from pull requests to improve code review quality and reduce noise.

use_cases.title: Maintain code consistency
use_cases.description: Enforce consistent coding style by removing AI patterns that deviate from project standards.

use_cases.title: Refine AI-assisted code
use_cases.description: Polish AI-generated code before committing to remove unnecessary patterns and improve readability.

prompt_templates.title: Before commit

output_examples.input: Use deslop to clean up the current branch
output: Moved 3 inline Python imports to file top
Cleaned up 2 casts to any that bypassed type checking
Summary: Cleaned up AI-generated patterns while preserving business logic changes

best_practices: Run deslop before creating pull requests to improve code quality
Review the changes deslop suggests before accepting them
Use deslop regularly to maintain consistent code style across AI-assisted contributions
anti_patterns: Running deslop without reviewing the proposed changes
Using deslop on branches with uncommitted work
Expecting deslop to fix logical bugs or security issues

faq.question: What is AI code slop?
faq.answer: AI code slop refers to excessive comments, unnecessary defensive programming, type casts to any, and style inconsistencies that AI assistants often generate.

faq.question: Does deslop modify my code?
faq.answer: Yes, deslop modifies files to remove identified patterns. Review the changes before committing to ensure nothing valuable is removed.

faq.question: Can deslop damage my codebase?
faq.answer: Deslop is conservative and preserves business logic. It only removes patterns like excessive comments or defensive checks. Always review before committing.

faq.question: What git branch does deslop compare against?
faq.answer: Deslop compares the current branch against the main branch using git diff main...HEAD by default.

faq.question: Can I customize what deslop considers slop?
faq.answer: The skill uses built-in patterns for common AI-generated issues. For custom rules, you would need to modify the skill or provide specific instructions.

faq.question: How is deslop different from a linter?
faq.answer: Deslop specifically targets AI-generated patterns in changed files, while linters enforce general coding standards. They complement each other.
